metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8350 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Smarty before 3.1.21 allows remote attackers to bypass the secure mode restrictions and execute arbitrary PHP code as demonstrated by "{literal}<{/literal}script language=php>" in a template.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8350` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

smarty3 - 3.1.21-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: smarty3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.21-1').
